required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Minimally Invasive Decompression and Fusion Versus Open for Degenerative Lumbar Stenosis
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Randomized Controlled Study of the Efficacy of Surgical Treatment in Patients With Single Level Lumbar Spinal Stenosis Using Minimally Invasive Decompression and Fusion and Traditional Open

lead_sponsor.agency: N.N. Priorov National Medical Research Center of Traumatology and Orthopedics

clinical_study.source: N.N. Priorov National Medical Research Center of Traumatology and Orthopedics

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effectiveness of minimally invasive decompression and fusion over the traditional open decompression and fusion in patients with single-level lumbar stenosis caused by degenerative spondylolisthesis. Postoperative follow-up will continue for 12 months. Ð¡linical, safety, radiological and cost-effectiveness endpoints will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI)
primary_outcome.description: To observe the change of ODI as compared to baseline through follow-up terms. min - 0, - the best result, patient is active; max - 50 - the worst result, patient is not physically active

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Oswestry Disability Index (ODI)
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the change of ODI as compared to baseline through follow-up terms. min - 0, - the best result, patient is active; max - 50 - the worst result, patient is not physically active

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Numeric Pain Rating Score (NPRS)
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the change of NPRS as compared to baseline through follow-up terms (0 - no pain, 10 - unbearable pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in EuroQol Five-Dimensional descriptive system questionnaire (EQ-5D).
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the change of EQ-5D as compared to baseline through follow-up terms. It assesses 5 components related to aspects of life: mobility, self-care, activity in daily life, pain, anxiety or depression. Each dimension has 5 levels: no problems, slight problems, moderate problems, severe problems and extreme problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Douleur Neuropathique 4 (DN4)
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the change of DN4 as compared to baseline through follow-up terms. The scale result ranges 0-10 points. The sum > 4 points indicates the neuropathic component of pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in The Health Transition Item from SF-36 (HTI Item)
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the change of HTI Item through follow-up terms. Patient's answers range from ''Much Better,'' ''Somewhat Better,'' ''About the Same,'' ''Somewhat Worse,'' to ''Much Worse.''

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Clinical Global Impression Of Change (CGIC) scale
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the change of CGIC through follow-up terms. The answers range from "-2 Significantly worse compared to Baseline" to "+2 Significantly improved compared to Baseline". 7-points scale indicates the patient's condition assessed by physician.
Total cost of surgical procedure (implanted system, the salary for surgery team) and the cost of patient's staying at the clinic before discharge.
Interbody fusion rate on CT based on Tan grades
To observe the sagittal balance parameter - Pelvic Incidence - by sagittal scans of spine by X-Ray, in degrees

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Pelvic Tilt
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the sagittal balance parameter - Pelvic Tilt - by sagittal scans of spine by X-Ray compared to baseline, in degrees

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Global Lordosis Angle
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the sagittal balance parameter - Global Lordosis Angle - by sagittal scans of spine by X-Ray compared to baseline, in degrees

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Segmental Lordosis
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the sagittal balance parameter - Segmental Lordosis (the angle of treated level) - by sagittal scans of spine by X-Ray compared to baseline, in degrees

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Sagittal Vertical Axis
secondary_outcome.description: To observe the sagittal balance parameter - Sagittal Vertical Axis - by sagittal scans of spine by X-Ray compared to baseline, in mm
Document Adverse Events (incl. adverse events related to device) occurrence throughout the study

arm_group.description: Patients will undergo a single level decompression and fusion using a minimally invasive technique. Followed posterior screw fixation is mandatory.
Patients will undergo a single level decompression and fusion using an open traditional technique. Followed posterior screw fixation is mandatory.

intervention.description: Transforaminal Lumbar Interbody Fusion will be performed using minimally invasive approach or traditional open technique.

facility.name: Priorov National Medical Research Center of Traumatology and Orthopedics

patient_data.ipd_description: Data are available upon reasonable request. Please contact the corresponding author for detail.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: During the study conducting and during 5 years after
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The approval of institutional review board will be necessary
